arch:property.oc:show_val: Well preserved. Fragments of top and side found in center. Intentional holes found inside. Perhaps for fuelling and stoking the fire or for slag run off at the bottom there is a yellowish 7.5 YR 8/3 Munselled Clay. This oven is very well preserved and we can even see the arc of the top of the oven.
The surface that is the origional surface with this oven is 3027. The floor of this oven 3044 is founded on wall 3037
Is composed of a baked clay. Is broken at seam and thumbprints of maker are visible

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: very well preserved. Most of the oven was still intact. Top was broken at the seam

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area C / Trench 3 / Locus 3003 (Locus)
